Test FAILed (JDK 7 and Scala 2.10).

The DailyRollingFileAppender can be problematic if left unmonitored. The DailyRollingFileAppender does not expose any properties which allow you to limit the total amount of  space the logs can consume. This means it's up to the user to clean up the logging directory from time to time to keep from exhausting disk space. 

For this reason I would like to suggest the use of the RollingFileAppender instead. This appender offers two properties which allow you control how much disk space the logs can consume. 

maxBackupIndex: how many backup files to retain
maxFileSize: the max size of each log file
retest this please
